resources.string: In the south of the province of Salamanca, in the heart of the Sierra de Francia, lies La Alberca, surrounded by extensive forests full of oak and chestnut trees. Sierra de Francia, lies La Alberca, surrounded by extensive forests full of oak and chestnut trees. Every corner of La Alberca has a special charm: its cobbled streets, its houses built of stone and wood and the roofs of the houses that and the roofs that are joined together in the air form an architectural ensemble in which to lose oneself and enjoy.\n

La Alberca, a magical setting, can boast of being the first village in Spain to be declared a Historic-Artistic Site in Spain, specifically in 1940. Its festivals, its traditions, such as the Moza de Ánimas or the Marrano de San Antón, its gastronomy… so many reasons that will make your visit an incomparable experience. As the poet and professor from Alberca, Don José María Requejo, likes to say, La Alberca is… \n
Are you new here? Do you want to take a free tour through the app?
This is the home screen of the application. You will be able to access all the other sections of the application from here.
The albercan house had three main parts: the stable, the dwelling and the storage place.\\n

Every fairytale village must have a dream setting, and La Alberca is no exception. Forests of pine, oak and chestnut woods give life to the surroundings of this village, with all kinds of routes where you can enjoy nature, the fauna and the pure air they offer us. \n
"If you want to spend more than one day in La Alberca to discover all its secrets, there are many accommodation options: \n "
What do you want to tell us?
What is the reason for your message?
The subject of the message cannot be empty
How to get to La Alberca?

The easiest way to get to La Alberca from the capital of the province is through the SA-215 highway, to the town of Tamames, where we will take the detour to the SA-201, which will take us to our destination after traveling 76 km. that separate Salamanca from La Alberca.\n
If you do not have your own vehicle to come to La Alberca or simply want to come by bus, there are bus lines with different round-trip schedules to visit the town:\n
La Alberca is located south of the province of Salamanca, bordering the province of Cáceres. Due to its bordering location, historically, La Alberca was known as the gate of Las Hurdes. \n
In the surroundings of La Alberca there are many other beautiful villages and places to discover. Here are a few options: \n
Villages of the Sierra de Francia
Villages of the Sierra de Francia

The gastronomy of the Sierra de Francia stands out for the high culinary value of the products used for its stews and delicacies, giving rise to preparations and products of the highest quality, which is why the recipes of the Sierra are so popular. \n

La Alberca is a village where you can eat a lot and eat well. Traditional dishes, grilled meats, homemade desserts, wines from the Sierra de Francia, tapas… a great gastronomic offer offered by the innkeepers who open the doors of their establishments every day to offer visitors the best of each house. \n

Las cárceles visitaba 
 con caridad peregrina 
 y su palabra divina 
 a los presos confortaba.
Click on the icons for more info.
No festivities were found this month…

This application was born out of love for a town, its people and its customs. I have been lucky enough to be part of them since I was born, and although it may sound cliché, there is no town that pampers its history and roots more than La Alberca. 

I would like to thank all the people who, directly or indirectly, have been involved in this crazy project. The time you have spent researching this wonderful village, the photographs you have taken of it and the dedication to spread the love you feel for La Alberca to the world have made the result of this application much better than I could have imagined. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. 

Thanks to my family and friends for their constant support and for the excitement of seeing the progress of each update of the application and seeing that in some way, they are represented in it.

Finally, thanks to my mother and my aunt Francis for being willing to collaborate at all times. This application is as much mine as it is yours.

Thanks to you, who are behind the screen of your device reading this, you are the main reason why this application exists. Now you only have one mission left:
What would a village be without its grocery stores, craft shops, bakeries…? Fortunately, in La Alberca we have a large selection of them, where both locals and onlookers can enjoy local products:\n
